com.rolledback.mapping

Class MapEditor

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • com.rolledback.mapping.MapEditor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class MapEditor
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener
    Similar to Launcher.java, but instead of starting a game, starts up the map editor program. The MapEditor class is also a JFrame, unlike the Launcher class which is entirely static. Controls for the map editor can be found in the readme file.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Matthew Rayermann (rolledback, www.github.com/rolledback, www.cs.utexas.edu/~mrayer)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • MapEditor

        public MapEditor(int x,
         int y,
         int t,
         int oH,
         int oV)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        x - width of the tiles map
        y - height of the tiles map
        t - size of the tiles (in pixels)
        oH - horizontal offset, used when game doesn't fill entire screen horizontally.
        oV - vertical offset, used when game doesn't fill entire screen vertically.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Starting location for all function calls of the map editor. Presents user with a dialog box containing a drop down box. Box includes a list of options to fill the entire screen with a given tile size (in pixels), a random choice of the tile size options, or the option to give the width and height desired.
        Parameters:
        args -

      • init

        public static void init(int x,
        int y)
        Starts the game based on the given parameters passed in from the user choices made in main. Handles creation of the window, game, and gui.
        Parameters:
        x - width of the tiles grid
        y - height of the tiles grid

      • paintComponent

        public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Redraws all map editor elements.
        Overrides:
        paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent
        Parameters:
        g -

      • drawBackground

        public void drawBackground(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Draws the background underneath the actual game tiles/units. All games, even if they fill up the entire screen actually have a background.
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics object, passed in by paintComponent

      • createBackground

        public void createBackground()
        Creates the background and stores it in the background matrix.

      • mousePressed

        public void mousePressed(java.awt.event.MouseEvent arg0)
        Handles mouse clicking for the editor. Calculates which tile the mouse clicked, and changes it to the currently selected texture. Then proceeds to redraw all tiles.
        Specified by:
        mousePressed in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener

      • mouseReleased
